title: DSA Level 5 â€” Stacks & Queues
concept: Stack operations, queue operations, balanced parentheses, next greater element, sliding window.

challenges.title: Implement Stack
challenges.description: Perform Q stack operations: PUSH X and POP. After all operations, print the remaining stack from bottom to top.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: Q. Next Q lines: either "PUSH X" or "POP". If POP on empty stack, ignore it.
challenges.outputDescription: Stack elements from bottom to top, or "Empty" if stack is empty.
examples:
Input:
5
PUSH 3
PUSH 5
POP
PUSH 2
PUSH 8

Output:
3 2 8

challenges.title: Implement Queue
challenges.description: Perform Q queue operations ENQUEUE X and DEQUEUE. After all operations, print queue from front to back.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: Q. Next Q lines: "ENQUEUE X" or "DEQUEUE". Ignore DEQUEUE on empty queue.
challenges.outputDescription: Elements from front to back or "Empty".
examples:
Input:
5
ENQUEUE 1
ENQUEUE 2
DEQUEUE
ENQUEUE 3
ENQUEUE 4

Output:
2 3 4

challenges.title: Balanced Parentheses
challenges.description: Given a string with brackets ()[]{} check if it is balanced using a stack.
challenges.inputDescription: Single line: string S containing only (), [], {}.

challenges.title: Next Greater Element
challenges.description: For each array element, find the next greater element to its right. If none, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N integers: next greater element for each position.

challenges.title: Previous Greater Element
challenges.description: For each element, find the closest greater element to its left. If none, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N integers: previous greater element for each.

challenges.title: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
challenges.description: Given heights of histogram bars, return the area of the largest rectangle.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers (heights).

challenges.title: Sliding Window Maximum
challenges.description: Given an array and window size K, print the maximum of every contiguous subarray of size K.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N K. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: First Non-Repeating Character in Stream
challenges.description: Characters arrive in a stream; after each insertion, print the first non-repeating character or -1.
challenges.outputDescription: After processing each character, print current first non-repeating or -1, separated by spaces.
examples:
Input:
aabc

Output:
a -1 b b

challenges.title: Queue Using Two Stacks
challenges.description: Implement a queue using two stacks and process ENQUEUE and DEQUEUE operations.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: Q. Next Q lines: "ENQUEUE X" or "DEQUEUE". Ignore DEQUEUE on empty queue.
challenges.outputDescription: Final queue contents from front to back, or "Empty".
examples:
Input:
4
ENQUEUE 1
ENQUEUE 2
DEQUEUE
ENQUEUE 3

Output:
2 3

challenges.title: Sort a Stack Using Recursion
challenges.description: Given a stack, sort it in non-decreasing order using recursion only (no extra data structures).
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers (stack from bottom to top).
challenges.outputDescription: Sorted stack from bottom to top.
